item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo A/C Cabin Shutoff Valve(s)

numlitem.para: Associated pack is selected OFF,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE remains OFF, and
Associated Pack Flow Control & Shutoff Valve is secured closed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard Lower Lobe Cargo Cond Air Flow Rate selector "LOWER LOBE CARGO A/C CABIN S/O VLV - INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Select discrepant pack to the OFF position. (Cargo A/C Forward Cabin Shutoff Valve – Pack 3; Cargo A/C Aft Cabin Shutoff Valve – Pack 2).
For an inoperative Lower Cargo A/C Forward Cabin Shutoff Valve secure Pack 3 Flow Control and Shutoff Valve closed as follows:
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Access valve through the air conditioning equipment bay access doors.
Manually rotate crank arm on end of butterfly shaft until valve is closed.
Run screw on end of crank into hole in the casting.

Manually select HI FLOW on remaining packs and advise crew that HI FLOW must remain selected to ensure that these packs will operate in High Flow Mode. The associated PACK ____ advisory message may be displayed.
If the affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve has an external maintenance canister installed containing a lockout device (a cap, a spring and a plug):

Remove the existing pack flow control and shutoff valve plug, packing, spring and filter from the inoperative Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve per AMM 21-51-13. Retain all removed parts for later storage in the canister.
Remove the perforated plug from the canister containing the lockout device (the canister is located near the end of the crank screw noted in step 1. D.).
Remove the cap and spring from inside the canister.
Install the cap and spring into the filter cavity: The small end of cap fits into the inside diameter of the spring. Ensure the cap is seated at the bottom of the filter cavity.
Apply anti-seize compound to the threads on the perforated plug obtained from the canister.
Install and tighten the perforated plug that was obtained from the canister: Tighten the plug to 60-70 pound-inches (6.78-7.90 newton-meters).
Install a lockwire on the perforated plug with the hole.
Place the removed plug, packing, spring and filter (from step 1. E. 1.) into the canister for storage and future restoration of the Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve function.
Position A/C Flow rate to HI FLOW on operative packs.
Position the Overhead Maintenance Panel (P461) CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector to OFF.
For an inoperative Lower Cargo A/C Aft Cabin Shutoff Valve secure Pack 2 Flow Control and Shutoff Valve closed as follows:
Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Access valve through the air conditioning equipment bay access doors.
Manually rotate crank arm on end of butterfly shaft until valve is closed.
Run screw on end of crank into hole in the casting.

Manually select HI FLOW on remaining packs and advise crew that HI FLOW must remain selected to ensure that these packs will operate in High Flow Mode. The associated PACK ____ advisory message may be displayed.
If the affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve has an external maintenance canister installed containing a lockout device (a cap, a spring and a plug):

Remove the existing pack flow control and shutoff valve plug, packing, spring and filter from the inoperative Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve per AMM 21-51-13. Retain all removed parts for later storage in the canister.
Remove the perforated plug from the canister containing the lockout device (the canister is located near the end of the crank screw noted in step 1. D.).
Remove the cap and spring from inside the canister.
Install the cap and spring into the filter cavity: The small end of cap fits into the inside diameter of the spring. Ensure the cap is seated at the bottom of the filter cavity.
Apply anti-seize compound to the threads on the perforated plug obtained from the canister.
Install and tighten the perforated plug that was obtained from the canister: Tighten the plug to 60-70 pound-inches (6.78-7.90 newton-meters).
Install a lockwire on the perforated plug with the hole.
Place the removed plug, packing, spring and filter (from step 1. E. 1.) into the canister for storage and future restoration of the Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve function.
Position A/C Flow rate to HI FLOW on operative packs.
Position the Overhead Maintenance Panel (P461) CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector to OFF.
